task_summary: The robot pours the contents of a cup into a mug using a coordinated arm motion. It detects both the mug (destination) and cup (source), moves above each object in sequence, performs the pour action, and then retreats from the mug.

task_long_description.overview: This sequence involves a robot arm equipped with a cup gripper. The scene includes a mug and a cup, arranged such that pouring is feasible. The robot detects the mug and moves above it, detects the cup (which it holds), moves above that, performs the pouring motion by tilting the cup over the mug, and retreats upon completion. The process relies on visual detection, positioning, and planned pouring. The main roles are visual perception and physical manipulation, with constraints on timing and safe alignment.
preconditions: Cup is already grasped by the robot
Mug is present and visible on the workspace
No obstacles obstruct the mug or the pouring path
stepwise_plan: Move the robot arm above the mug
Move the robot arm above the cup
Perform the Pour action: tilt the cup over the mug
Retreat the arm away from the mug
success_criteria: Contents of the cup are poured into the mug
No significant spillage on the workspace
Cup and mug remain undamaged and properly placed
failure_and_recovery: Cup or mug not detected: retry object detection
Pour action incomplete: reattempt pouring if safe
Collision detected: halt and retract to safe position
task_long_description.termination: Task ends when pouring is complete and the robot has retreated safely.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Move the robot arm above the mug.
Move the robot arm above the cup.
Pour contents from the cup into the mug, tilting the cup 90 degrees over the mug.
Move the arm away from the mug after pouring.

failure_modes: Unexpected collision or obstruction during execution
recovery_strategy: Retry detection if an object is missing
Abort and retreat if a collision is detected
Retry pouring if incomplete and safe to do so
assumptions: Cup is already grasped by the robot at episode start (not shown in frames).
Frame progression aligns with mug detection, approach, pouring motion, and retreat but actual grasp/pick is not depicted.
Instruction requests 'pour into the mug', and visual evidence supports this by showing the mug, cup, and arm motion.

expected_success_criteria: The mug contains the cup's contents at episode end
Robot does not spill outside the mug
